Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Quantitative EEG in Delirium Subtypes

Participants.evidence: Participants were assigned to post-stroke, medical, or postoperative delirium subtypes based on DSM-IV or DSM-5 criteria.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to investigate whether quantitative electroencephalography (qEEG) characteristics differ among etiology-based delirium subtypes or converge on common neurophysiological patterns.

Method_Outcome.evidence: We compared peak frequency, relative power, and phase lag index (PLI) between delirious and non-delirious patients using standardized mean differences (SMDs) with 95% confidence intervals (CI).

Result_Outcome.evidence: Peak frequency consistently decreased in all delirium groups compared to controls (SMD = -0.81, CI: -1.50 to -0.13), relative delta power increased (SMD = 1.44, CI: 0.61 to 2.26), and relative beta power decreased (SMD = -1.72, CI: -2.46 to -0.97).

Funding.evidence: The study was funded by institutional resources.
